comment: Polgar prefers this move which often leads to games with many tactical rather than postional possibilities.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6
comment: Black plans to develop the bishop on g7.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6 4. O-O Bg7 5. c3
comment: White plans to play 6. d4 with a strong center.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6 4. O-O Bg7 5. c3 e5
comment: To prevent 6. d4 5... d6 would have been better.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6 4. O-O Bg7 5. c3 e5 6. d4
comment: The pawn sacrifice is justified on the basis of White's lead in development and Black's weaknesses on the dark squares.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6 4. O-O Bg7 5. c3 e5 6. d4 cxd4 7. cxd4 Nxd4 8. Nxd4 exd4 9. e5
comment: This move keeps Black from developing normally. If 9... Bxe5 then 10. Re1 f6 11. f4 would win the bishop.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6 4. O-O Bg7 5. c3 e5 6. d4 cxd4 7. cxd4 Nxd4 8. Nxd4 exd4 9. e5 Ne7
comment: Black want to castle to safety as soon as possible.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6 4. O-O Bg7 5. c3 e5 6. d4 cxd4 7. cxd4 Nxd4 8. Nxd4 exd4 9. e5 Ne7 10. Bg5
comment: Putting pressure on the weak dark squares.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6 4. O-O Bg7 5. c3 e5 6. d4 cxd4 7. cxd4 Nxd4 8. Nxd4 exd4 9. e5 Ne7 10. Bg5 O-O 11. Qxd4
comment: White has her pawn back and is still in an excellent position.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6 4. O-O Bg7 5. c3 e5 6. d4 cxd4 7. cxd4 Nxd4 8. Nxd4 exd4 9. e5 Ne7 10. Bg5 O-O 11. Qxd4 Nc6
comment: If now 12. Bxd8 then 12... Nxd4. Or, if 12. Bxc6 then 12... Qxg5.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6 4. O-O Bg7 5. c3 e5 6. d4 cxd4 7. cxd4 Nxd4 8. Nxd4 exd4 9. e5 Ne7 10. Bg5 O-O 11. Qxd4 Nc6 12. Qh4 Qb6
comment: Attacking the bishop and threatening 14... Bxe5.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6 4. O-O Bg7 5. c3 e5 6. d4 cxd4 7. cxd4 Nxd4 8. Nxd4 exd4 9. e5 Ne7 10. Bg5 O-O 11. Qxd4 Nc6 12. Qh4 Qb6 13. Nc3
comment: White is delighted to sacrifice the pawn for the attack.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6 4. O-O Bg7 5. c3 e5 6. d4 cxd4 7. cxd4 Nxd4 8. Nxd4 exd4 9. e5 Ne7 10. Bg5 O-O 11. Qxd4 Nc6 12. Qh4 Qb6 13. Nc3 Bxe5
comment: It is dangerous to grab a pawn when behind in development, but the pawn on e5 kept Black's queen bishop hemmed in. Besides, Black now threatens 15... Bxc3 16. bxc3 17. Qxb5

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6 4. O-O Bg7 5. c3 e5 6. d4 cxd4 7. cxd4 Nxd4 8. Nxd4 exd4 9. e5 Ne7 10. Bg5 O-O 11. Qxd4 Nc6 12. Qh4 Qb6 13. Nc3 Bxe5 14. Rae1
comment: White ignores Black's threats and continues with her development. If Black refuses the piece and plays 15... Bg7 the following is a possible continuation: 16. Bc4 d6 17. Nd5 Qxb2 18. Nf6+ Bxf6 19. Bxf6 (Threatening Qh6) 19... Qd2 20. Re3 h5 21. Qg5 Kh7 22. Bd3 Ne5 23. Qxh5+ Kg8 24. Qh8#.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6 4. O-O Bg7 5. c3 e5 6. d4 cxd4 7. cxd4 Nxd4 8. Nxd4 exd4 9. e5 Ne7 10. Bg5 O-O 11. Qxd4 Nc6 12. Qh4 Qb6 13. Nc3 Bxe5 14. Rae1 Bxc3
comment: The dark squares now belong to White.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 g6 4. O-O Bg7 5. c3 e5 6. d4 cxd4 7. cxd4 Nxd4 8. Nxd4 exd4 9. e5 Ne7 10. Bg5 O-O 11. Qxd4 Nc6 12. Qh4 Qb6 13. Nc3 Bxe5 14. Rae1 Bxc3 15. bxc3 Qxb5 16. Qh6
